title: Little Mix star Jesy Nelson's brother hospitalised after party fight
text:
Little Mix star Jesy Nelson's brother Johnny has been hospitalised after a bust-up at a Halloween party.

The confrontation took place in a London bar early yesterday and was said to have left 30-year-old Mr Nelson with a broken nose.

Police are investigating the incident which took place at Beach Blanket Babylon in Shoreditch, where party-goers included a number of reality TV stars such as Mark Wright and Love Island's Josh Denzel.

Horrific: Little Mix star Jesy Nelson's brother Johnny has been hospitalised after a bust-up at a Halloween party (taken February 2018)

Friends of Johnny claim the dispute flared up over messages which had been sent to Nelson's fiancée Gabby.

Sources at the party said a second man involved in the altercation was ex-boxing Olympic gold medalist James DeGale. But he denied even being at the party.

Mr DeGale, 33, who is an MBE and won a gold medal at the Beijing Olympics told MailOnline: 'That's b****cks. That's a load of s**t.

'I wasn't there. It's got nothing to do with any girl.'

A source at the club said: 'Everyone was having a great time on Saturday until it all kicked off.

Family: The confrontation took place in a London bar early yesterday (Sunday) and was said to have left 30-year-old Johnny with a broken nose – but Jesy was not at the party

Siblings: Sources at the club in Shoreditch said 'everyone was having a great time until it all kicked off' allegedly between Johnny and former boxer James DeGale (taken in January 2017)

'The situation got heated': An eyewitness said 'after having a bit to drink Johnny got into an confrontation' and James was involved (taken December 2018)

In the ring: Olympic gold medalist James retired from boxing in February after 10 years as a professional (taken February 2019)

'After having a bit to drink Johnny got into a confrontation, but the situation quickly got heated.

'Johnny was knocked to the floor. The police were called and Johnny was treated at the scene by medics and then rushed to an east London hospital in an ambulance.'

An insider added: 'Johnny suffered a broken nose and needed stitches but thankfully his injuries weren't life threatening.'

The Metropolitan police confirmed to Mail Online: 'Police are investigating an allegation of assault. There have been no arrests. Inquiries continue.

'Officers were called at 01:19hrs on Sunday, 27 October to a night club on Bethnal Green Road, E1.

Lovebirds: Friends of Johnny claim the dispute flared up over messages which had been sent to Nelson's fiancée Gabby (taken September 5)

'A man was reported to have been assaulted. A 30-year-old man was found at the location with head injuries.'

A London Ambulance spokesperson said: 'We were called at 1:22hrs on Sunday, 27 October to reports of an incident on Bethnal Green Road, Shoreditch.

'We dispatched a medic in a response car and an ambulance crew to the scene. We treated a man at the scene and took him to an east London hospital.'

Mark Wright came dressed to the Halloween party hosted by event organisers Vanity List as a clown, while TOWIE stars Kelsey Stratford and Ella Rae Wise attended in sexy outfits.

Love Island's Josh Denzel was also at the bash as well as former TOWIE cast member Mike Hassini.

Family: Jesy, 28, has been pictured alongside brother Johnny's fiancée Gabby in June 2018

Masked man: TV presenter and former TOWIE star Mark Wright was at the same Halloween party disguised as a clown (taken October 27)

Scary! Fans of Mark, who's married to Michelle Keegan, will have struggled to identify him at the event after he came dressed in a black jumper and terrifying mask

Jesy's brother recently celebrated his engagement to Gabby after popping the question during a holiday in Mykonos in September.

Singer Jesy, who's in a relationship with Chris Hughes, commented on her brother's announcement with a love heart eyes emoji and heart and applauding hands emoji.

TOWIE's Courtney Green, Ferne McCann, Danielle Armstrong, Nicole Bass and Love Island's India Reynolds were among other stars to wish the couple congratulations.

Little Mix announced last week they have been forced to cancel their upcoming tour dates in Australia and New Zealand, which were set to take place in December.

Leigh-Anne Pinnock, Jade Thirlwall, Perrie Edwards and Jesy were faced with the tough choice after taking on new commitments including a BBC TV show.

A spokesperson for Beach Blanket Babylon said: 'We are fully aware of an incident that happened on Saturday and we're helping police with their enquiries.'

Looking good: TOWIE's Kelsey Stratford and Ella Rae Wise attended the Halloween party in sexy outfits
description: Little Mix star Jesy Nelson's brother Johnny has been hospitalised after a bust-up at a Halloween party. The confrontation which is said to have left Johnny with a broken nose.
